newsitem.title: BRAZIL: RESEARCH ALERT-Ericsson Brazil still a buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Ericsson Brazil still a buy.

text.p: Fator Securities said it was reiterating its buy recommendation on Ericsson Telecomunicacoes S.A., the Brazilian unit of Sweden's Telefon AB L. M. Ericsson
-- In a report, Fator analyst Sergio Missima also said he was setting a target price of 82.56 reais, for a potential upside of 21.4 percent over the current price.
-- Ericsson preferred was off 1.18 percent at 67.20 reais while its common was up 5.58 percent at 54.90 reais at 1614 local/1514 EDT/1914 gmt in Sao Paulo.
-- He cited the telecom equipment maker's first-half revenues and backlog of orders in the January-June period.
-- "Booked orders at the end of the first half stood at 1.817 billion reais, 49.5 percent up on the end of the end-of-December figure of 1.215 billion reais," he wrote.
-- Moreover, Ericsson is taking part in bids for contracts totalling $255 million worth of conventional telephone equipment, he added.
-- The company also reported first-half 1997 net revenues of 466.6 million reais, up 40.7 percent year-on-year, he said.
-- "Despite this impressive figure, higher growth was expected (but) was frustrated by delays," Missima wrote.
